result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey C. Gerarden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Includes domestic abuse surcharge. 
Cash bond applied.

Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with the victim; agent may modify only in writing. 
Contact necessary for exchange of the minor child will be allowed, only in a lawful manor. 
All other family/placement related matters will be governed in the family case.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent, to include Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program, and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant shall notify Agent within 48 business hours of new or changing prescriptions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey C. Gerarden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Judge to DOC regarding unpaid financial obligations.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Sent JOC to Atty Walczak in ppe provided

DA John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Walczak.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed today.
The defendant enters a plea of no contest to the sole count in the complaint.
Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant was found guilty.
Victims were notified, per D.A.
Victim impact statement filed with the Court.
Statements to the Court by the victim.
Statements by counsel.
Statements by defendant.
The Court orders an imposed and stayed sentence of 45 days in jail. 
Defendant placed on probation for a period of 1 year. 
Conditions:  
1) pay all costs and fees, to include the Domestic Abuse surcharge, 
2) undergo and complete all counseling deemed appropriate by the agent, to include the Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program,  and abide by all treatment recommendations, 
3) take medications only as prescribed, notify agent of all meds and any changes to them within 48 business hours  
4) no contact directly or indirectly with the victim; agent may modify only in writing. Contact necessary for exchange of the minor child will be allowed, only in a lawful manor.  All other family/placement related matters will be governed in the family case. 
Appeal rights were provided.
